page.title: 12LANDSCAPE
page.content: There are three main areas comprising the landscape. The USAF Woodbridge Air Base surrounded by wire fences and much barbed wire contains defence buildings, a water tower, church and schools; this area is flat. There is some farmland with mixed copses and shelter belts, and a 1939/45 wartime hut. The largest area undulates and is covered by heathland merging into coniferous forest. There are broad tracks and footpaths and the forest itself has one metalled road. The forestry plantations are numbered and a small stream and a valley feeds two reservoirs. There is the occasional metal hut and water container. A large area has been clear-felled and such land is replanted with trees as soon as possible after clearing.
